pullRequest.title: KAFKA-7658: Follow up to original PR
pullRequest.bodyText:
add more unit tests
fix bug for auto-repartitioning
some code cleanup

Follow up to PR #7985. Call for review @vvcephei @highluck
For PR must be cherry-picked to 2.5 branch.

nodes.bodyText: Renaming this variable in this class and all its sub-classed to make it more clear what it is for

Creating this MaterializedInternal was actually a bug as if the passed in "store name" was null, no store name would be generated, and we would fail with an NPE. It's fixed implicitly with the refactoring (this bug was exposed after I rewrote a test -- leave a comment there, too)
Just some cleanup to get rid or warnings.
The is nothing to be deprecated -- also the comment is confusing as maintainMs / segmentInterval are not use in this method
Adding couple of new test to verify we don't accept nulls.
This line was added in the original PR for no reason -- just removing it again.
Making the test a little bit fancier.
Changing this test, to also change the key type to make sure we can pass in serdes correctly.
Overwrite key-serde to match type (this was exposing the "store name == null" bug).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2455,14 +2482,13 @@ public void shouldSupportKeyChangeKTableFromKStream() {
         final String output = "output";
 
         builder.stream(input, consumed)
-            .map((key, value) -> new KeyValue<>(key + "-", value))
-            .toTable()
+            .map((key, value) -> new KeyValue<>(key.charAt(0) - 'A', value))
+            .toTable(Materialized.with(Serdes.Integer(), null))

nodes.bodyText: Due to the refactoring of the KStreamImple#toTable() overloads, we get different names -- but as nothing is released yet, there is backward compatibility concern.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2475,27 +2501,27 @@ public void shouldSupportKeyChangeKTableFromKStream() {
                 "    Processor: KSTREAM-FILTER-0000000005 (stores: [])\n" +
                 "      --> KSTREAM-SINK-0000000004\n" +
                 "      <-- KSTREAM-MAP-0000000001\n" +
-                "    Sink: KSTREAM-SINK-0000000004 (topic: KSTREAM-TOTABLE-0000000003-repartition)\n" +
+                "    Sink: KSTREAM-SINK-0000000004 (topic: KSTREAM-TOTABLE-0000000002-repartition)\n" +

nodes.bodyText: This check is redundant, because we know there is only one sub-topology (ie, copartitionGroup) from the topologyDescription check above.
Just a code simplification -- no need to not use props similarly to the other tests.

nodes.bodyText: This is an actual fix in the test code.

oh! this is good
thank you,
It was my mistake

I agree with this
"subTopologySourceNodes" is more clearly named

commit.message:
KAFKA-7658: Follow up to original PR

- add more unit tests
- fix bug for auto-repartitioning
- some code cleanup
Partly revert HOTFIX (https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/8063) that seems not to be the correct fix

afterCommit.message: Partly revert HOTFIX (https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/8063) that seems not to be the correct fix
